24QU-_Ud4bOFuZmxL0zPog.text: Great little brunch spot - food was fantastic (I had the pancakes, and my friends had the fritters and savory waffle). The portions are very large and filling, and good sized for the prices. It does get crowded so I would advise coming earlier. We got there at 11 and there was a 30 minute wait.

k7Tu2hRvmhZroburPYRg-g.text: Walking up to the Caledonian Road & Barnsbury overground stop, I needed coffee. I didn't just want it, I required it in my body and had a responsibility to buy some. I traced the map in my head and nothing jumped out at me screaming, "good coffee here!" until I remembered Sunday. I had walked past the new restaurant a couple weeks prior and admired the typography on a hanging paper cup that was advertising its arrival in the neighborhood. When I went in, it was all smiles and easy banter that would have convinced me to stay and tuck into one of the beautiful breakfasts they were serving if I hadn't been pressed for time. As I waited for my iced Americano, I asked whether Sunday had free wi-fi, picturing myself "working from home" there while basking in an atmosphere much livelier than the one surrounding my small basement desk. And the answer was yes!I can't comment on the food because I didn't indulge in any, but it all looked divine - especially the lemon drizzle cake that took all of my willpower to resist. However, Sunday just received a stunning review in The Independent, so it seems everything tastes as good as it looks.

MvY9hJbzs1T41RwaT7WiVA.text: When my husband and I lived in Seattle, USA, we had a restaurant we ate at almost weekly.  Since moving to London, it's been challenging to find a place within walking distance that equaled the quality and without a huge price tag.We spotted Sunday during one of our runs around Islington and put it on our list of places to try.  Finally, on one of the evenings when cooking just seemed like a terrible idea, we decided to venture over to try it out.We loved it!  And it has since become a regular dinner destination for us.On our most recent visit, we ordered the chorizo and potato salad as an appetizer, and the lamb, trio of ravioloni, and a beef dish for entrees.  For dessert (or should I say pudding), our friend ordered the chocolate Turkish delight tart and we had the nutter butter ice cream sandwich.  All of these dishes were fresh, tasty, and high quality.  Another plus to Sunday is that the staff are lovely and attentive.  Truly, the only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is the space is really tiny, which can make the atmosphere a bit loud and cold if you're sitting by the door.  Also, it can be challenging to maneuver and there really isn't a space to wait for your table.  A minus when it's chilly and thus don't feel like waiting outside!Once your seated though, you won't be disappointed!

GbkGvQ5-B6wBZ4qxbRec9A.text: This  is my favourite breakfast cafe in London. The food is always perfect. I heartily recommend the French toast - better than sex! There's always a queue though so always track a staff member down to get your name on the list or you'll be waiting a long time.

YiCFrGX7ExHJubSC5lx2cA.text: Best brunch in London - we wound up ordering 3 dishes for two people since there were so many good options and it definitely didn't disappoint. Can be a wait at times but definitely worth it!

Pm6mt4rixOfwu6HWnhGRAQ.text: My favourite brunch spot!... and I brunch A LOT. Have tried a few of the menu options here and they've all impressed. You do have to queue (no res policy) but it's worth the wait! The pancakes with honeycomb butter are a winner, as are the corn fritters! I will continue to go back again and again!

ienuLzsUvqxIP1NfacwmEQ.text: A hidden gem of Islington, not well hidden enough! Queues on Saturday mornings for brunch, however the staff seat people promptly as soon as a table is available. I've never waited for more than 10-15 mins for a table. Plus for the garden area that's now open downstairs is an awesome spot to hang out and chill in for a coffee or breakfast. Seating area is small inside but nobody really seems bothered as everyone is too busy enjoying the delicious food. The menu has great variation so there's something for everyone, and portions are generous. Have also been here twice for dinner, high quality food with superb taste and elegantly presented. Cannot stop going back here!

UHPyO6PORP7ghVWIa-kjcw.text: Laid back atmosphere, and although not the cheapest spot for a coffee in the area the food and drinks offer is superior and the service is great. One of those great local spots where you get to know the staff and they in turn let you know when they have a freshly baked cake that will be just perfect for your mid morning indulgence.

rfj4ZT4JLaV-Rj-SGvq3yw.text: Outstanding. Sunday has vaulted to the top of my London Brunch list, serving delicious food (I would particularly recommend the Blueberry Pancakes with Honeycomb butter and the Huevos Rancheros) and great coffee in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. I'd note a huge array of choices (for a seasonal and market-driven restaurant, the menu is surprisingly long) giving just about every palate something to crave coming for. 5/5

wCc-ZctNAYkwOzzgTaEbgA.text: If you ever visit Paris one thing that city does really well at the moment, food-wise, is the weekend brunch experience. It really does put London to shame, in my opinion at least. While sitting at Sunday's, on an actual Sunday I had that same feeling I get in Paris, so am i fan for the atmosphere and cuisine but the problem I have, as I do in Paris, is that this comes at an inflated cost. I am a little autistic, i work in maths, so when I go to an eatery I tend to tot up the numbers in my head for the relative cost of a meal v potential operating costs to work out the value for money. With Sundays the sums just don't add up. The restaurant is situated on Hemingford Road which, as quant as it is, isn't a central location and therefore shouldn't and won't have the same rental costs as restaurants in Hoxton or Upper St, Islington. So why, I ask myself, are the costs for breakfast as expensive, if not actually more pricey than in those locations? I guess its a lack of competition and an inflating of prices due to affluent catchment area with very little competition. If we look at the floor space p/m2 it isn't that huge of a restaurant either. Assessing the food and service, yes both were very good and I applaud the chef for his thoughtful menu. I like going to this brunch place, as its the only decent one within a ten minute walk of my girlfriends house but i hate the feeling I'm being hit in the pocket every time i show up. Maybe they pay their staff very well, maybe they use more sustainable produce than other places. I like it here a lot but its overpriced a lot too.

PZNJFD35ex91hk7IPo1wmQ.text: *No Reservations. Small and cute place for brunch/lunch/coffee/whatever you feel like that requires good food and coffee. I ordered the corn fritters and kiln smoked salmon. It was a good dish. Well put together. I liked how the corn fritters were not at all fried. They were light and went well with the salmon. However, they were a tad bit on the dry side. My friend didn't want his egg from his smoked chicken dish, so with the egg, it was a good portion. Without the egg, I would probably have still been hungry. So my advice is to order a side of eggs with this dish. We also ordered the Green chilli cornbread dish and this was so so. The beans salsa was pretty much just black beans and diced tomatoes. There was no flavor combustion that you usually get from salsa. I think they need to go back and experiment with the "salsa". But for a small local spot like this, the kitchen seems to put a lot of care into the food and I do notice that. Overall great place to have brunch or lunch. Staff is nice and place is cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Smoked chicken & chorizo hash, sweet potato, chilli fried eggs 9.50
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Flat white
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

VKksRpCyQSli1yO9pjkYEQ.text: Went for brunch after having heard good things about this place ... And they were correct :) probably the best brunch meal i've ever had. I had the courgette fritters and added bacon, my friend had the huevos rancheros  - delicious!! I will definitely be heading back as there were so many options on the menu that i'm excited to try out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Courgette fritters

xi6KYTXax3qjGRdX5IFdgA.text: This a busy cramped place that lets you wait outside in the rain...The wait for food is loooong, we were waiting 40 mins for two dishes...So why on Earth does it deserve the full five stars, well as you may have guessed this little place is a gem and at the risk of making the rainy queues longer I'd heartily recommend it.Its a small beautiful intimate hipster central cafe with great food, minty water (in old wine bottles) and a great atmosphere. This particular visit was tinged with seeing my friend off before emigration but what a way to go, we had a very nice blackbean, pork belly and chorizo stew with a topping of corn bread and a poached egg. A really beautiful meal of the level of the former Assiette Anglais on the nearby Liverpool Road. This place is not only as good in terms of food but much cheaper.This is certainly a great replacement even if they have to get a little faster and I have to wait in the rain.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Black bean stew with chorizo and pork belly. Topped with a poached egg and corn bread

0JO4zqKTuPeXQDoeKY3Azw.text: This place is perfection -- wonderful and creative menu, adorable space, delicious fresh food etc etc.But more usefully: we got here at 9:15AM on Saturday and got the last free two-top, by the time we left at 10:15 there was a ~15 person queue outside.  I loathe queuing, and so would plan accordingly.  Also everyone who works here has the best hair/style ever.  I want to come back for outfit advice.  Definitely worth your time to travel north to!

fq-VotbAEUiFIfKhUEXIIg.text: I live right around the corner from here and have had it recommended by many Islington locals, but it wasn't until I had a early weekend morning with no prior brunch reservations that we decided to give it a try (as they don't take reservations). I looked up the opening hours and figured that arriving around 10 AM was ok, but we arrived at 10:05 AM and unfortunately the entire restaurant was already full, as it is clear that people queue up before the doors open. The restaurant is pretty small and there are only about 25-30 seats inside, so I would not recommend coming with a group larger than 4 people.Luckily it was not raining so we sat at one of the tables outside and were able to order coffee while we waited for a table to free up. About 45 minutes later, the first round of brunchers were finishing up and we were seated at one of the tables close to the kitchen. I got the huevos rotos, which was chorizo, peppers, and some other veggies and scrambled egg and served on top of bread with avocado. Two of my friends got the corn fritters served with kiln smoked salmon, which is not your typical raw-ish slices of smoked salmon but rather a large piece that seems more cooked with a smoky flavor. The last one got the Welsh rarebit with smoked haddock, which was also a more cooked version of smoked fish.Overall the food was good and service was quick, but I do find the no reservations policy a bit annoying and I would have definitely been irritated if we waited any longer. There was a large queue of about 15 people by the time we left, and most order takeaway coffee to drink while they wait, as most don't even get the luxury of waiting at an outdoor table. The staff was pretty stressed about the situation and the close quarters are not exactly comfortable. But everyone seemed to be a local and it continues to be very popular, so do come early or be prepared for considerable time in the queue!

1JoItZZPOg4W7RzDnKFXQg.text: Restaurant Sunday in Barnsbury definitely lives up to its hype as I just had the loveliest (late) lunch there. I was a bit worried the place would be packed as I was warned in many reviews but I had no problem getting a table. It was actually really nice and quiet. Just right! I ordered the salmon salad and only word for it is perfection! Very tasty, big portion, healthy and nice heat from the chilli sauce on top. And the dish looked beautiful too. I live a 5 minute walk from this place and I'll definitely become a regular now. I need to go try their breakfast options next, yum yum. I highly recommend Sunday to everyone looking for brekky, lunch or brunch in the Barnsbury area. Superb choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

a1pA5XIclWCSFi4dYY-hbw.text: Tiny space inside, be prepared to wait. We arrived at 11:30 am on a Sunday and the queue was crazy, so we weren't seated until 12:30 pm.We ordered the corn fritters with salmon dish, the fried courgette, and the chorizo hash. Our favorite was the fried courgette, delicately placed around a tower of poached eggs and avocado. The corn fritters were a bit dense but the chorizo hash was delicious.The BEST part of our whole meal with the banana bread. Get it warm and spread the cinnamon butter on top. It will make your whole Sunday at Sunday.

SH7puVVTHTPXjFJblNh0Ww.text: Must come to place for brunch! If you're in London this is really worth the journey for the amazing selection of brunch food! They elevate every classic brunch food to make it out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Must get
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. So good!

69lL98IbJbbC_4x8td_y6Q.text: The best Full English I've ever had (and I've eaten A LOT!) The scrambled eggs were incredible!!

IqGTRtKtGHwkxKqHGsO5VA.text: One of my favourite places to brunch in the area, Sunday's always delivers delicious and Instagram-able breakfast food. I've tried the huevos rancheros which was perfectly balanced in flavour, and the corn fritters which came with so much avocados on the side that I couldn't finish them all.If you can hold off on having brunch for a little while, I think the queue goes down a lot after 2pm. But if you have to queue up for a bit, but it's totally worth it. The staff are always friendly, and you can even order coffees while you wait - I highly recommend the chai tea latte.

2UvGxICZvFHBihmEdw79Gw.text: Absolutely my favorite place in all of London. You want fresh and healthy? You can get fresh and healthy. You want fried chicken and waffles to rival what they make in the southern US? You got it. Want a mound of pancakes with bacon on top and a honey butter dripping in syrup, heck yes and it's delicious. This isn't just because it's the best place in the area, but genuinely awesome.

pWrdQWhPW96ffVdcp9MGig.text: Friendly service. Great brunch , both savoury and sweet! Tried the pancakes and the chorizo / eggs. Menu changes daily I believe. Relaxed atmosphere and pet friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

Fe1-UmZ_BIKJo1ujL-yyYQ.text: my neighborhood brunch spot over the summer.  get here early because the lines get pretty epic!! it's a small little brunch spot, reminds me of abbot kinney in venice, california. can't go wrong with the English breakfast and egg hash dishes. try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs, chickpeas, chorizo (only 3 pieces), and cornbread

HDBA2H-GsPlBBr9Qfm1Img.text: We had a late dinner here, on a Thursday.This appears to be a neighborhood favorite and the staff was lovlely. Food was tasty, fresh, and comforting. The environment had a outdoorsy countryside vibe that would be perfect for brunch in the summer.

yuSDk4OOasr3BfmGRb726A.text: One of the best brunch places I've ever experienced in my thirty years on this planet. The huevos rancheros was out of this world.

U1UxQzT40wfvXtgnAQ71ZA.text: I seriously don't get the massive appeal of this place. Granted the food is lovely and the owner is lovely but there is just something about the place that I don't get. Perhaps it is its massive popularity. People seem to travel from far and wide at the weekends, and queue up outside for ages to get into a very small, cramped and noisy coffee shop. There is not even enough room to squeeze in between tables placed next to each other, and god love you if you are left to sit on the horrible stools at the window or the two seater table by the counter. The place is soooo cramped it is uncomfortable. And I hate eating somewhere that people are queuing up outside waiting to come in I just feel rushed. I have even seen the owner turn to an old man (who seemed to be a regular), that was in no rush to leave and ask him to move to a smaller table so she could get more people in. He did exactly what I would of done which was leave!!During the week it seems to be made up of a local business crowd sitting there for hours doing business on their mac books, or having business meetings. It does have a little more of a chilled vibe.On my last visit my sister wanted just a toasted sandwhich and even though it is something the do with rarebit, they couldn't alter the dish to just cheese on toast!! But were quiet willing for her to get pancakes without bacon, but still charge for it. As I said the quality of food is lovely, but the cramped, loud and rushed feel of the place makes this place very unappealing even though its right on my doorstep.

ie3jQVdkSS-paER50Uqh9A.text: Absolute local gem!GREAT coffee, AWESOME food, WONDERFUL staff, COSY interior, DELIGHTFUL experience.With a rotating menu based on fresh supplies, breakfast and brunch items include the likes of sautéed spinach and mushrooms on sourdough, bacon and poached eggs, pea and ham soup, huevos rancheros... the smoked chicken with bacon jam toastie was a winner. Generous portions and everything lovingly crafted from the kitchen. Damn and the barista knows what they are doing!!!Closed Mondays.

Ib7k6ReHaK2p14qZby2P3A.text: Two of us went on a Wednesday to avoid the queues, and worked well. We only had a five minute wait at noon, before we were seated at a small table near the counter where they display the cakes. Our server was very friendly and chatty. I was boring and ordered the avocado toast, which was surprisingly good with seasoning that set it apart from the hundreds of others available throughout Islington. My friend ordered a squid salad that she raved about for days. The menu rotates seasonally and is available on their Facebook page, but later in the day, some of the more popular dishes are often sold out.The coffees and cakes are a great way to prolong your brunch and avoid the rain. I highly recommend the toasted banana bread.

3qnBmziZvNeFq_KL9Q5Lug.text: Absolutely delicious food and great coffee. The only downfall is that the place is so small and overstuffed that you can barely move without knocking into someone else. It's also extremely loud. If the venue was bigger it would be a much more relaxing, enjoyable brunch experience.

tipf3nCKom0TzouzjSio3A.text: My new find in North London and my new love. This is THE place to go to for breakfast/brunch. It does a stack of wonderfully fresh and tasty pancakes, some ace iced coffees and if you can get a table outside it's a delight.

LO_x-2-lJ152cvbNgzE6Nw.text: 5 star brunch. It really is that good! Ok so this may have been the longest I have ever waited for breakfast. We arrived around 10am and waited over an hour an a half in the freezing cold before we were seated- but oh it was worth it!The staff were incredibly friendly, while we were waiting outside they came and brought ever perfect a hot cup of tea to make the wait in the freezing cold more tolerable. The menu is small and the food takes a while to come out, probably 30 minutes, but thats because each dish is intricately crafted and freshly made. We ordered curried eggs with scallion pancakes and sweet potato pancakes.The flavor combinations were unexpected but they worked together perfectly. These people have brunch down to a science. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with bacon and a fried plantain
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Curry Eggs and Scallion Pancake

UbbehDU4UQg2tPptBbHMJA.text: Okay so in update, I have to upgrade Sunday to 5 stars. I've been back twice more, and gone through much more of the menu.Every time, Sunday has been exceptional. The service is friendly, the ambiance comfortable, and the food IS SO GOOD. Well worth even the longest wait.Sunday is the best brunch in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

ZcST9v86LYrW8GP8eK6lSQ.text: Damn this place knows how to do breakfast!While on vacation we made sure to bookmark this spot for a Sunday breakfast - no puns intended. They open at 9 on weekends and a line starts to form quick, so if you want to skip the waiting - come early. After about 30 mins in line we got a spot inside and were soon rewarded. The pancake stack with honey comb butter was melt in your mouth delicious. Do yourself a favor and order the corn fritters on the side, they were da bomb. The avocado with them was incredibly fresh. The girls inside were friendly and did a great job taking care of us! Next time we're in North London we will be here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Brekky Lunch!
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Storefront
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with bacon, fruit and honeycomb butter

Ircai0Z79J_9DS3FFT7vMA.text: Service is great and so is the food. Got the Buttermilk Fried Baby Chicken and Waffle. Chicken was very flavorful. Waffle was served with a slaw on top with corn. Flavors went well together. Will definitively be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Chicken w/ Waffle
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino

D3iXXmy4UwnjfMi5k5npww.text: Felt like having some eggs but made nicely by someone who can cook well, so basically not me, and found out that I was walking distance from here! Got there at around 11.30am on a Saturday and there was already a line about 10 people long!!! Luckily it went by rather fast and the restaurant is actually bigger than it seems. They definitely need more waitstaff as the wait for getting served omce you're seated plus waiting for your food CAN be a long one. The iced tea is really refreshing and not too strong on the Earl Grey side, which I was really pleased about. It just tastes like a proper lemonade but with a kind of muted fruit taste...? Not sure if that makes sense, but you can taste the tea but it is not overpowering.I knew I wanted something with eggs but I was so very tempted by the french toast and pancakes... I could see them being served to others and they looked AMAZING. Ended up getting Huevos Rancheros with a side of corn fritters. SO FILLING. BIG MISTAKE. It was really tasty so it was worth it, WHATEVER IT'S BRUNCH. Only downside was the avocados were not too ripe so they were really hard and so not that tasty and the corn chips at the bottom on the bowl got super soggy super fast which was Sad. The corn fritters are sooo tasty as well!!! Also filling. They came with sour cream and some kind of a chutney or jam thing that I honestly didn't touch. Almost a 5 star rating but only because there was so much waiting involved and they left the chorizo in my eggs even though I asked for it to be removed. :( DEFINITELY COMING BACK FOR SWEETS THOUGH.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Corn Fritters
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Rancheros - corn chips + 2 sunny side eggs + spiced black bean salsa + avocado + chorizo
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Very very VERY busy from 11-2! Be prepared to wait to get in, to be served and to get food...!

l7mMa_-EWT5PjaP3wI5r-A.text: Yup. They hype is real.The staff are hit and miss by the food is really and truly great.It's an oasis in a good brunch desert (hence the queue).Not for every week bc sometime I just want to be fed right then and there but definitely worth the wait for a special treat.My faves so far the pancakes and the smoked haddock rarebit. Will slowly make my way through the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. From the top
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. The 1/2 portion of pancakes (not sure why one would get the full portion unless sharing or having a massive sweet tooth/pancake craving)
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Banana bread (1 of 2 pieces that comes in the portion)

CThMqOig9kGCXSRGddDa1A.text: We were lucky and came right before the rush! If you don't want to wait in line get there early! My friends got the Eggs Benedict and they absolutely loved it. I got the Honeycomb pancakes with bacon and everything literally melts in your mouth. Amazing! I have never been so satisfied with a breakfast meal until I came here.  The service, vibes, and food was absolutely up to par. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Honeycomb pancakes with bacon! AMAZING

ieo7yjAIFP034JDfUdcu4Q.text: This might be the longest I have ever waited for brunch!This teeny teeny café is really popular at the weekend and my friends and I arrived at about 11:30, so I guess it was exactly the same time as the rest of North London needed their yummy brunch fix. We were told it would probably be 30-40 minutes... and I hadn't seen my friends for yeeears so we got ready for a good chat to pass the time. After an hour, we still had not been seated, but by then we'd invested so much time that we just kept waiting. The menu looks really good, and we could see other people's brunches so we just wanted to try EVERYTHING. Alas...in the end it took 2 hours before we got seats(!!!) I really did enjoy my corn fritters with salmon, and everything my friends and I ordered looked amazing, and tasted even better. So the food is really delicious. And I *would* like to come back...maybe on a weekday when I wouldn't have to wait. But I will never, never bother coming back here at the weekend. Don't do it! Even small queues can take an eternity here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Yellow corn fritters (for #yelplondonrainbow yellow)

uEsE4ttrgKSQSYFedpq10Q.text: This place is so quaint and lovely. I immediately liked Sunday because it's sort of tucked away and you don't really expect to find a great brunch spot here. We came in the afternoon and I had toast with avocado. Another reason for liking this place- they manage to take toast and avocado and add a little magic and love, because that was the best tasting toast and avocado I've ever had. It was drizzled with olive oil, some arugula, lemon and chili flakes. Simple ingredients, yummy in my tummy. My friend got salad with smoked salmon, and that smoked salmon was absolutely delicious! I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Toast with avocado, salad and chili

aj9EWFXrEyuG-VsnFmuhHA.text: Excellent brunch spot! I'd argue the vegetarian options outweigh the meat ones. They don't take reservations, so just queue up - you're in for a treat!All the egg dishes are great, but the courgette fries stacked on top of halloumi was outstanding, as was the French toast topped with salted caramel, caramelized bananas and cream. Coffee was decent, as was the aperol spritz. It reminded me of brunch in San Francisco.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Spinach & mushrooms with poached eggs on toast
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Decadent French toast

T9yrUHq0z-xJBLMQbhQw-g.text: Look guys, I am freshly back in the Big Smoke. So you gotta be gentle with me. I still gotta get re-used to the fact that there are places where one's gotta queue for an hour to grab some eggs benedict.That being said, Sunday cafe might have been a hella appropriate re-introduction into the city life for me. It blew my mind in all the typically London-esque ways.Mindblown element 1: "Heeey, let's grab some brunch on a THREE P.M. on a Sunday (does that even count as brunch anymore?!) and STILL wait for 45 minutes to get a seat in this cafe (which btw seems to be located in bumfrick nowhere as far as Angel goes - how does everyone know its secret?! Oh I gettit - that's why we have Yelp!). ** Cries bitter tears **Mindblown element 2, 45 mins later: "Omnonomnomnom these are the best eggs ever what is happening in my mouth, I totally get it - this is why London is London."Honestly, I can't believe I'm saying it, but great effing food worth the wait. My eggs had the nicest pistachio relish ever which just went fabulously with the avocado and the very well flavoured salad. All the rich flavours and the egg yolks mixing and soaking into my fluffy bread = epicness of epic proportions.The service is really nice - we were quite intrigued with a couple of items on the menu and the gentleman serving us very helpfully walked us through everything. Water for the table is complimentary (which is useful, because for my taste, and that's the only bummer here, the drinks are a wee on a small side. I could use a proper big mug of chai / coffee with such a heavy brunch). The atmosphere is really chill and perfect for a Sunday - even with a full capacity, the place somehow manages to give off a relaxed and relatively intimate vibe. Unfortunately we tried it on a rainy day, but someday I'd like to sit in the little courtyard area behind - it looked cozy.So yes, do definitely come here for a big treat brunch, but get your small talk ready for some serious lazy wait - I sincerely hope that I made somebody's next Saturday's line another 5% longer with this review by convincing y'all to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

xsGEMom4nBGnFmIBvPVJiw.text: This small hipster joint has been on my brunch list for a while. First impressions: slightly rustic vibe, damn that queue and I want to get my hands on everything on that menu. My brunch partner and I went the sweet route and got the pancakes, brioche French toast and toasted banana bread. I love that they also do half portions of both their pancakes and French toast which means you can try both these dishes without bursting the seams of your trousers. The banana bread was YUM, especially the delicious cinnamon butter it was served with. French toast, on the other hand, didn't quite blow my mind. The caramel sauce tended to dominate too much. Decent effort regardless. Service was alright, although smiles were in short supply. Be prepared for a long queue after 10am on the weekend and for cramped seating space (which just means constant food envy!) but for me, I am already planning a second visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Brioche French toast with banana, caramel sauce, mixed berries and cream
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Toasted banana bread
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate

S4Z-snS5xeE1K5DxGqzQ6Q.text: Super and delicious with a warm ambience.It is a bit far from central London buy if you take the overground it's about a 5min walk. Try and come her midweek as weekend is about an hours wait but totally worth it!Small groups are better (no more than 4 ppl) as the place is tiny but the food makes up for it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Bacon pancakes
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Corguette fritters

6JRpYfpqopfFlIkvz0gWrg.text: Wow... So best brunch in London? I can't say I've tried them all, but you'd be struggling to find anything much better. If you're lucky enough to have the time, then stop by here on a weekday to avoid 30-60 minute weekend queues. The food here is outstanding. The first time I came it was for lunch because I was staying nearby and wanting something a bit healthier than a chippy or kebab shop. I waited 10 minutes or so and was seated by on the bar by the window. It's a tight space. But I was easily able to enjoy my scrambled eggs on toasted sourdough... I mean, this really sounds underwhelming, but it's some of the best scrambled eggs and toast I've had in ages! I decided to go for the kiln smoked salmon on the side, but considering I live in Scotland this wasn't out of the ordinary for brunch for me and wasn't quite worth the extra 3.50... But if you're not from somewhere it's readily available, then it was a tasty addition. On my second visit, the wife and I waited about 30 minutes and then were able to get a table outside. I got the courgette fritters... Wow! These were amazing. They were topped with Parmesan, on top of avocado and halloumi with a stunning poached egg in the middle on a base of yogurt. This is seriously one of the best brunches I've ever had. While we were sitting at our table you could hear multiple customers talking about their brunch plates and the items they ordered... This is a rare occasion at any restaurant... At least in a positive sense like this.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs on roasted sourdough with kiln roasted salmon

7si2TrnTjOtN30xfG8r_Fg.text: Divine brunch spot! The pancakes here are off the charts! I got a half portion which was more than enough - 2 big fluffy pancakes with bacon and maple syrup. Great coffee, always always busy so be prepared to queue for a little while as you can't book a table. Top brunch spot in London!

EPlR0lzU9mrnYM0dga_1WA.text: Came to Sunday on a Sunday, because of course.Prepare to queue up. It took about 40 minutes at 1:30pm. But you can revel in the fact that you will be having a quality brunch feast once you're finally seated.The rotating menu, which is comprised of an even mix of always on the menu classics and seasonally inspired items, is up on their Facebook page. Don't study it too hard beforehand or your heart will get broken. Or get there early (i.e., when they open at 10am) to guarantee that they don't sell out of what you want.First time I'd seen my fave brunch entree of shrimp & grits on a London menu so I had to have it. I got the last order of the grilled tiger prawns, soft corn grits, chorizo, chili fried eggs entree, which made my day. Don't want to think about the distress and misery I caused the next person who attempted to order it. Food came out relatively quickly (15 min or so). Both my brunch date and I marveled at the colorful presentation of my plate (the placement of those tender and sweet corn kernels though!). The flavors melded well together - succulent sweet shrimp, spicy chorizo, creamy grits, fresh avocado slices.The wait staff were friendly and let us linger despite the steady stream of customers waiting on line. They were prompt in bringing us the check when we asked for it and asked several times if everything was satisfactory. The table next to ours ordered the berry pancakes, which looked ridiculously amazing and they kept oohing and aahing over them - that's what I'll be having the next time I'm here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Grilled tiger prawns & soft corn grits, chorizo, chili fried eggs

Bko20AtF09Hdp7HCxA5-HA.text: Huge portionAmazing pancakes with bacon and honey such perfect combination ! However their famous French toasts are not impressive. too much caramel sauce makes it super duper sweet! The frenchtoasts weren't eggy and cripsy as I would expect and the banana brûlée actually make the dish even more heavy ...

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom

TPbVKWcT5xWgxJd9IkikgA.text: Came here for brunch on a Saturday, and the line was out the door around 2:00pm. Waited for about 15 minutes and had a table.Once inside, it took about 15 minutes for someone to take our order. Water with fresh mint was in the table. Ordered coffee first, and the cappuccino was wonderful! The food took a while, but it was worth it. Had the buttermilk pancakes, bacon, syrup and butter with a side of corn fritters for lunch. Huge portion size! The pancakes were moist and fluffy and all-around perfect. Perfectly cooked, high-quality bacon was latticed on top with a generous helping of maple syrup. The only downside was the fruit on the plate; while it added to the presentation, it had been soaked in some sort of sugary syrup BEFORE being placed on the plate. Sugar overload! If it were fresh, it would have added something really lovely to the taste.The atmosphere is cozy and warm. The place is quite small and elbow room is in short supply, but the flavors of the extensive menu make up for that. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Buttermilk pancakes with syrup, butter and bacon.
Photo of Sunday - London, United Kingdom. Corn fritters

HSq-ex7J-ByMPH_uV47nwg.text: This place is a little gem, tucked away in the side streets of Barnsbury.A 15 minute walk from Angel station set amongst the houses of Victorian suburbia. What makes this place so perfect is that it exists outside the hustle, bustle and commerciality of Islington's Upper Street (which is literally just around the corner).First things first. If you're coming at the weekend expect to queue. I've been here in the week and been seated outside immediately but this most recent visit was at the weekend and the wait was around one hour. Still, there are worse places to wait. The quaint and peaceful surroundings only help to add the experience.Once inside (or outside, there is a Garden to the rear) expect social seating. The place is tiny. Kitchen, cloakroom, stairs to garden, dining room almost all in one. I love it. Don't be put off, it's all part of the joy.The menu is extraordinary. The difficulty will be choosing only one dish to enjoy. On my most recent visit, I had the buttermilk chicken and waffles. Cooked to perfection, delicious and incredibly generous portions for the price (£12). I have to say I was jealous of the my friend's choice of corn fritters, they simply looked amazing.Even with the queue constantly maintaining length and duration outside, there is such a laid back vibe here. Don't expect to be rushed, turned or hurried. Come, relax, enjoy a terrific meal with the friendliest staff you're likely to find anywhere.

NfGphwqHSoVZLDn4O4joDw.text: AMAZING!!! I am always looking for exciting & interesting brunch/breakfast places. Obviously its not like there's a lack of these places around town, but it's harder to find places that do special food. something extra special compared to your ordinary scrambled eggs or eggs  Florentine/Benedict.... That's great definitely but can be done so easily. At the moment, my "extraordinary" brunch place is Lantana (check out my review!) but this new little place right by my old flats form 5 years ago on Caledonian Road is a gem! Stupid levels of queue all day on Saturday & Sunday. I even heard people are starting queueing during the week too... Mhm... not ideal AT ALL but definitely worth the wait, but I do recommend going as early as physically possible & patiently wait in the queue with your lovely coffee in hand. Went there with a couple of my girl friends so we were able to try quite a few different things ont he menu! Oh my god, what a menu! That's what i can exciting, that's what i cal interesting! I am salivating just thinking about it. Recommendation as follows : Courgette fritters! French toasts & the stacks of pancakes also blew my mind! The savory waffles looks amazing too. Not once did i see a plate and wasn't impressed. I need to go back and try everything.
